unittitle_ssm: Jake Green National Maritime Union Photographs
abstract_ssm: Jake Green was a member of the National Maritime Union (NMU). The collection contains ten photographs concerned with the NMu, including images of the union's national conventions and officials, as well as Baltimore local NMU officials and events.
corpname_ssm: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives
National Maritime Union of America -- Portraits
collection_ssm: Jake Green National Maritime Union Photographs
heading_ssm: Jake Green National Maritime Union Photographs

collection_ssm: Jake Green National Maritime Union Photographs
Jake Green National Maritime Union Photographs
unittitle_ssm: The following eight 8x10 b&w photographs: - Top National Maritime Union Leaders (Unity Conference 3/30/46), L to R: Josh Lawrence, Ferdinand Smith (National Secretary), Revels Cayton (of International Longshoremen's and Warehouse Union) - Credential Committee (Eddie Gordon, far left) - 1947 NMU Credential Committee. (Eddie Gordon fourth from left, Stanley Postek, 2nd from right. - Captain Mulzac and company officials.) - Launching SS Frederick Douglass, Fairfield, MD, May 22, 1943. - Launching of SS Frederick Douglass, Fairfield, MD, May 22, 1943. (Center, 4th from the left, James Drury, NMU Port Agent, Baltimore, with company representative. Ferdinand Smith, captain? 3rd mate - John.) - Image of a mural (?) of a man crushing a Nazi U-boat and towing ships behind him. - Men standing on a stage, holding up letters that spell out part of "Support President Roosevelt" with same mural of man crushing a Nazi u-boat in background
heading_ssm: The following eight 8x10 b&w photographs: - Top National Maritime Union Leaders (Unity Conference 3/30/46), L to R: Josh Lawrence, Ferdinand Smith (National Secretary), Revels Cayton (of International Longshoremen's and Warehouse Union) - Credential Committee (Eddie Gordon, far left) - 1947 NMU Credential Committee. (Eddie Gordon fourth from left, Stanley Postek, 2nd from right. - Captain Mulzac and company officials.) - Launching SS Frederick Douglass, Fairfield, MD, May 22, 1943. - Launching of SS Frederick Douglass, Fairfield, MD, May 22, 1943. (Center, 4th from the left, James Drury, NMU Port Agent, Baltimore, with company representative. Ferdinand Smith, captain? 3rd mate - John.) - Image of a mural (?) of a man crushing a Nazi U-boat and towing ships behind him. - Men standing on a stage, holding up letters that spell out part of "Support President Roosevelt" with same mural of man crushing a Nazi u-boat in background

collection_ssm: Jake Green National Maritime Union Photographs
unittitle_ssm: Two oversized (11x 19) b&w photographs: panoramic group shots of the Fourth Biennial Convention of the National Maritime Union, New York City, July 6, 1943, and the of the Sixth Convention NMU, September 22, 1947, also in New York City. In these photographs the following individuals have been identified: Danny Boano, Bill Penman, Bill McCarthy, and Stanley Postek.
